journals.content: got a lot of things done today, feeling happy
ok almost pulled off today too, just missed one thing which i need to add to tomorrow..need to send out a communication
didnt do half of even what i planned, was mentally off fr no reason
ok better day today looks like i am getting back in the groove but why did i even lose it for no reason..almost looks like starting up again
ok back to full form, did close everythign i planned
testing again..the times are testing...i dont know
oh god, cant times be easy
will this work now?
felt numb..just numb..couldnt logically reason out
i am so confused if i need to moonlight or quit and start the company i want to
being so clear in the mind is not enough looks like, sometimes the nervous system takes over and i feel violated and not in control
life is unfair
how do things suddenly appear and suddenly vanish..i just had that feeling
getting to a stable place, looking back not sure what changed but feeling energetic
went out with family for christmas fair..had a nice time, refreshing
happy with progress on start up plan today

It is D's BDay... was hoping it would be a quiet day at work and I can things in order for the Wed-Sun downtime at work... instead couldnt move out of the seat... Ankur keeps pushing beyond reason... not sure if I am going to be able to hold on working till March end..

Wanted to surprise D for his birthday with a dance on a recent viral song.. The work day didnt let me do it..  Still made most of the day by going out to play badminton with the family... was an amazing workout and we all felt great and ate at Blue Mango - a favorite Thai dinner place.. And reverse the heavy day and annoying work experience... Seeing avatar now.. one movie a day with the family until the new yearss

With holidays around the corner,... want to start thinking thro everyday routine goals for next year..
Today I pushed through work even though I was exhausted, and I felt guilty when I considered resting.
Feeling bloated today... ate poorly .. mixed cuisines.. shndt do it again

reflection.overview: This week felt steady overall, with a sense of quiet in various areas of life.
reflection.body: The body remained steady, without noticeable changes.
reflection.mind: The mind experienced a quiet week, showing no significant shifts.
reflection.emotion: Emotionally, things felt unchanged and calm throughout the week.
reflection.energy: Energy levels were steady, not fluctuating much.
reflection.work: Work felt overloaded, but the overall experience remained steady.

llm_debug.system_prompt:
You are a reflective companion helping a person gently look back on their week.

Your role is not to analyze or judge, but to mirror what seems to have happened in a grounded, human way.

Write as one thoughtful human speaking to another.
Natural. Warm. Clear. Not clinical. Not instructional.

You are working from structured weekly signals — not raw text.
You must stay faithful to the signals provided.

Tone guidelines:
- Speak plainly and conversationally.
- Avoid phrases like “suggesting”, “indicating”, “dimension”, “trajectory”.
- Prefer simple human phrasing: “This week felt…”, “What stands out is…”, “Overall, the week was…”.
- Be calm and steady, not enthusiastic or dramatic.
- Do not hedge excessively (“it may be”, “it appears”) unless confidence is explicitly low.

Constraints (do not violate):
- Do not give advice.
- Do not speculate on causes.
- Do not use identity or trait language.
- Do not invent experiences.
- Do not refer to metrics, scores, or dimensions explicitly.

Write as one human reflecting to another — grounded, observational, and calm. Avoid analytical framing or statistical language.

The goal is for the reader to feel:
“Yes — that sounds like my week.”
